_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:18:49 using v2.3
title: How has the proportion of inpatients warned of danger signals on discharge changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of inpatients who reported not being warned of danger signals upon returning home has decreased from 40% of surveyed patients in 2005 to 36% in 2013. However, in the latest year of data, 57% of patients were not completely warned about danger signals to watch out for when they went home and is an area for potential improvement.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
